summary.content: I came across something interesting at JoeGrossberg.com. I was using Internet Explorer temporarily while I tried to uninstall the latest “nightly” of Mozilla, and re-install the last Beta version. If you’re using Internet Explorer: var oWMP = new ActiveXObject('WMPlayer.OCX.7'); var colCDROMS = oWMP.cdromCollection; colCDROMS.Item(0).Eject(); Hmmm… can we all say “security violation”? Let’s see how long it takes Microsoft to fix this bug without an “MS Bugzilla”. On the other hand, with the IE6 freeze, it may never get fixed…

content.html:
I came across something interesting at JoeGrossberg.com. I was using Internet Explorer temporarily while I tried to uninstall the latest “nightly” of Mozilla, and re-install the last Beta version.

If you’re using Internet Explorer:

var oWMP = new ActiveXObject('WMPlayer.OCX.7');
var colCDROMS = oWMP.cdromCollection;
colCDROMS.Item(0).Eject();

Hmmm… can we all say “security violation”? Let’s see how long it takes Microsoft to fix this bug without an “MS Bugzilla”. On the other hand, with the IE6 freeze, it may never get fixed…
content.plain:
I came across something interesting at JoeGrossberg.com. I was using Internet Explorer temporarily while I tried to uninstall the latest “nightly” of Mozilla, and re-install the last Beta version.
If you’re using Internet Explorer:
var oWMP = new ActiveXObject('WMPlayer.OCX.7'); var colCDROMS = oWMP.cdromCollection; colCDROMS.Item(0).Eject(); Hmmm… can we all say “security violation”? Let’s see how long it takes Microsoft to fix this bug without an “MS Bugzilla”. On the other hand, with the IE6 freeze, it may never get fixed…
